BULLETIN NO. 151 
BUSINESS RISK ASSESSMENT AND MANAGEMENT 
12/03/2024 
 
 
 
 
 
This Bulletin updates and replaces Bulletin 48, issued in 2011. Business Risk Assessment (BRA) plays 
an important role in any fuel handling facility's Governance and management activity, by providing the 
organisation with a complete view of the risks inherent to its activity, and the way in which they are 
managed and controlled. 
Good Practice Guidance: 
 
The updated guide to BRA, GP 4.01 JIG Business Risk Assessment and Management for Aviation 
Operations, is now available for download from the JIG Website. It contains new guidance as well as lists 
of risk scenarios that frequently occur in fuel handling facilities. 
Business Risk Assessment Tools: 
The guidance document is accompanied by a new user-friendly BRA 2.0 Tool, that can be used instead 
of the original CP4.02 JIG CP Management System Best Practice. The Tool is being released in two 
versions, a blank (unpopulated) version to support the good practice method of conducting a BRA from 
scratch, and an "Example" version that contains 33 new Risk Scenarios. Both versions can be 
downloaded from the same place on the website: 
GP 4.02 - JIG BRA 2.0 Tool * 
Training Packs and Online Courses: 
This new BRA Guidance is supported by revised Training Packs (GP4.03) and Facilitator Notes. 
There is also an online course (GP6) on the

.02 - JIG BRA 2.0 Tool * 
Training Packs and Online Courses: 
This new BRA Guidance is supported by revised Training Packs (GP4.03) and Facilitator Notes. 
There is also an online course (GP6) on the JIG Learning Hub that explains the basics of BRA. 
Similarly, the new BRA Tool has a Training Pack / User Guide (GP4.06) and an online version of the User 
Guide, course (GP7). Both publications show users how to complete a BRA using the tool that JIG has 
made available. 
JIG Recommendations: 
 
JIG has updated its BRA materials, having recognised a need to retain the industry knowledge of the 
principles of BRA, its associated Governance actions, and to promote the use of BRA at aviation fuel 
handling facilities. The use of BRA is an industry good practice and is recommended for use by all JIG 
Members. 
There is also a new JIG Website page under Governance Processes that summarises the guidance and 
provides links to the publications mentioned in this bulletin. 
 
https://www.jig.org/operations-and-safety/common-processes/business-risk-assessment/ 
 
 
SUMMARY : This Bulletin updates and replaces JIG Bulletin 48. It contains 
updated Business Risk Assessment (BRA) Guidance, a new BRA 2.0 Tool, 
and Training Courses. Though the guidance is intended for JIG JVs, it has 
been developed to be relevant for any organisation handling aviation fuel 
on airports.

Existing JIG Requirements: 
Please note that Bulletin 48 required JIG JVs to complete and maintain a complete Business Risk 
Assessment before 2014, to review it annually and conduct a revision with an external expert every 3 
years. The requirement for JIG JVs to have an active BRA with annual review is maintained. The 3-year 
revision with an expert is now considered a good practice, though highly recommended, especially for 
large or complex facilities. 
More Information: 
JIG will be holding 2 webinars on 19th March to introduce its guidance materials and the new BRA 2.0 
Tool. Please sign up here: 08:00hrs (CET) Webinar or 13:00hrs (CET) Webinar 
*Please note that the BRA 2.0 tools are available in different sizes, according to the complexity of your operation and expected 
number of risks to be detailed. The file size does affect the upload and save speed, but after opening the document, the 
functionality and speed of all versions are the same.
